name: HD 113996
scenarioDescription:
The HD 113996 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HD 113996 is a star with 1.49 times the mass of the Sun, and 25.11 times its radius. It is located 379.45 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 3.24 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

HD 113996 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HD 113996 system


HD 113996 b

HD 113996 b was discovered by the Bohyunsan Optical Astronomical Observatory observatory using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 1.60 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 113996 b is 2003.3999999999999 times the mass of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HD 113996 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system HD 113996, which contains 1 planets and was discovered by Bohyunsan Optical Astronomical Observatory.
